qas.question: Where can one find the Srijana Contemporary Art Gallery?
The Moti Azima Gallery contains objects that might be found in a Nepalese house of what time period?
What art gallery is located close to the Durbarmarg Royal Palace?
Where can the Nepal Art Council Gallery be found?
In which of Nepal's art galleries can one take an art class?

context: The <a4_0>Srijana Contemporary Art Gallery<a4_0/>, located inside the <a0_0>Bhrikutimandap Exhibition grounds<a0_0/>, hosts the work of contemporary painters and sculptors, and regularly organizes exhibitions. It also runs morning and evening classes in the schools of art. Also of note is the Moti Azima Gallery, located in a three storied building in Bhimsenthan which contains an impressive collection of traditional utensils and handmade dolls and items typical of a <a1_0>medieval<a1_0/> Newar house, giving an important insight into Nepali history. The <a2_0>J<a2_0/> Art Gallery is also located in Kathmandu, near the Royal Palace in Durbarmarg, Kathmandu and displays the artwork of eminent, established Nepali painters. The Nepal Art Council Gallery, located in the <a3_0>Babar Mahal<a3_0/>, on the way to Tribhuvan International Airport contains artwork of both national and international artists and extensive halls regularly used for art exhibitions.
